input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: HPSMActor.

The items for the adapter request. This should be an XML document with a root element named "items" having a children "item" (to support multiple item support, we give "item" multiple times), which should contain the data necessary to execute the specific request.
Update Company:
This wrapper updates company record via the application. The application saves this record into its repository which can later be used.
Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>update-company</operation-name> <model> <keys> <customer-i-d> <value>Tulip Customer</value> <type>String</type> </customer-i-d> </keys> <instance> <customer-since> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </customer-since> <customer-i-d> <value>Tulip Customer</value> <type>String</type> </customer-i-d> <company-code> <value>Company Code</value> <type>String</type> </company-code> <address-line1> <value>Address - updated</value> <type>String</type> </address-line1> <city> <value>City</value> <type>String</type> </city> <state> <value>State</value> <type>String</type> </state> <country> <value>Country</value> <type>String</type> </country> <zip-code> <value>Post</value> <type>String</type> </zip-code> <phone-number> <value>Phone Number</value> <type>String</type> </phone-number> <fax-number> <value>Fax Number</value> <type>String</type> </fax-number> <last-updated> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </last-updated> <service-manager> <value>Service Manager</value> <type>String</type> </service-manager> <service-delivery-manager> <value>Service Delivery Manager</value> <type>String</type> </service-delivery-manager> <company-name> <value>Company Name</value> <type>String</type> </company-name> <default-s-l-a> <value>155</value> <type>Int</type> </default-s-l-a> </instance> </model> </item> </items>
Elements’ Description: Update Process takes place in following manner-
The record is first found by the information provided in the <keys> element. Populate <keys> element with valid key elements otherwise the record wouldn’t be located.
Once the record is located, the fields are updated by the information provided in <instance> element. That is, the respective fields of located record are replaced by the elements’ values that are provided in <instance> element.
NOTE: While locating a record, complete matching of key is required. This means if you give key value to be “abc” and there is a record in the application repository which has key element as “abc123” then this record wouldn’t be located for the update (compare with Find Wrappers.)
Modification/Update in located record is done in following manner-
Suppose a random element with name <random-element> which has an 'fieldValue1'. i.e. on retrieving, we'll get.
<instance> ... ...
<random-element> <value>fieldValue1</value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> ... ... </instance>
Now see following cases of updation-
Case-1: <instance> </instance>
i.e., we don't provide even the element <random-element> Result: the field get ignored, i.e. not updated.
Case-2: <instance> <random-element> <value></value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> </instance>
i.e., we don't provide anything inside <value> element (child of element <random-element>.) Result: the field get ignored, i.e. not updated.
Case-3: <instance> <random-element> <value> </value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> </instance>
i.e., we provide an space character " " (or more contiguous space characters, like " ") inside <value> element (child of element <random-element>.) Result: the field gets updated, and the field <random-element> is set to blank " ". This is valid for all fields which are not mandatory fields.
Case-4: <instance> <random-element> <value>fieldValue2</value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> </instance>
i.e., we provide "fieldValue2" inside <value> element (child of element <random-element>.) Result: the value "fieldValue2" is set to field of <random-element>.
NOTE: One can update the key elements too.
Complete Elements’ Description:
item [Required]: This is a child of <items>. This <item> tag can be multiple times to support "multiple items support".
operation-name [Required]:
This specifies the operation that needs to be performed.
Valid values: <operation-name>update-company</operation-name> is valid operation name element.
model [Required]: It is the parent tag for containing all other tags.
keys [Required]: used to ask application to search for the record with the elements inside it.
Instance [Required] : It can have many children. The children of this element describe fields of a record.
Customer-since[Optional] : The date-time since what the customer exists.
Valid Value: any input in ‘DateTime’ format. This format is- YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example,
2008.11.01 08:00:00
Name of this element in the application: “Customer Since.”
Default Value: None, field will not be updated if no value is provided
customer-i-d [Required]: Customer ID.
Valid Value: Any String.
Name of this element in the application: “Customer ID.”
Default Value: None, field will not be updated if no value is provided
Company-code [Optional]: Code of company.
Valid Values : Any String.
Name of this element in the application: “Company code.”
Default Value: None, field will not be updated if no value is provided
Address-line [Optional] : Address.
Valid Values : Any string. Name of this element in the application: “Address.”
Default Value: None, field will not be updated if no value is provided
City [Optional] : City of the company.
Valid Values : Any string. Name of this element in the application: first field of “City/State/Post Code.”
Default Value: None, field will not be updated if no value is provided
State [Optional] : State name.
Valid Values: Any string. Name of this element in the application: Second field of “City/State/Post Code.”
Default Value: None, field will not be updated if no value is provided
Country [Optional] : Country.
Valid Values: Any string. Name of this element in the application: “Country.”
Default Value: None, field will not be updated if no value is provided
Zip-code [Optional] : zip code.
Valid Values: Any string. Name of this element in the application: Third field of “City/State/Post Code.”
Default Value: None, field will not be updated if no value is provided
Phone-number [Optional] : phone number.
Valid Values: Any string. Name of this element in the application: “Phone Number.”
Default Value: None, field will not be updated if no value is provided
Fax-number [Optional] : Fax Number.
Valid Values: Any string. Name of this element in the application: “Fax Number.”
Default Value: None, field will not be updated if no value is provided
Service-manager [Optional] : Service manager.
Valid Values: Any String. Name of this element in the application: “Service Manager.”
Default Value: None, field will not be updated if no value is provided
Service-delivery-manager [Optional] : Service delivery manager.
Valid Values: Any string. Name of this element in the application: “Service Delivery Manager.”
Default Value: None, field will not be updated if no value is provided
Company-name [Optional] : Company name.
Valid Values: Any string. Name of this element in the application: “Company Name.”
Default Value: None, field will not be updated if no value is provided
Default-s-l-a [Optional] : Default SLA.
Name of this element in the application: “Default SLA for Company.”
Valid Values: Any integer. For example “155”. (application specific nature.)
Default Value: None, field will not be updated if no value is provided

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>
